data.enText: if a part of your body is sore , it is painful, and often red, especially because of infection or because a muscle has been used too much
to have a sore throat
His feet were sore after the walk.
My stomach is still sore (= painful) after the operation.
upset and angry, especially because you have been treated unfairly
an ointment to reduce soreness and swelling
a sore point
a subject that makes you feel angry or upset when it is mentioned

data.chText: 孩子们至今未受洗礼，这是休的父母的一件伤心事。
data.enText: It's a sore point with Sue's parents that the children have not been baptized yet.
stand/stick out like a sore thumb
to be very noticeable in an unpleasant way
like a bear with a sore head
bad-tempered or in a bad-tempered way
a sight for sore eyes

data.chText: 喜欢见到的人（或物）；赏心悦目的事物
data.enText: a person or thing that you are pleased to see; something that is very pleasant to look at
a painful, often red, place on your body where there is a wound or an infection
open sores

data.chText: 以上各词均指使人肉体上疼痛的。
data.enText: These words all describe sth that causes you physical pain.
painful
causing you physical pain

data.chText: painful可用于身体部位、疾病、受伤、治疗或死亡等：
data.enText: Painful can describe a part of the body, illness, injury, treatment or death.
Is your knee still painful?

data.chText: 一次又一次令人痛苦的注射
data.enText: a series of painful injections
a slow and painful death
sore

data.chText: 指（身体部位）发炎疼痛的、肌肉酸痛的：
data.enText: (of a part of the body) painful and often red, especially because of infection or because a muscle has been used too much
a sore throat

data.chText: 他们走了几小时的路把脚都走疼了。
data.enText: Their feet were sore after hours of walking.
raw

data.chText: 指（身体部位）红肿疼痛、破损、擦伤：
data.enText: (of a part of the body) red and painful, for example because of an infection or because the skin has been damaged
The skin on her feet had been rubbed raw.
excruciating
extremely painful

data.chText: excruciating可用于情感、待遇或死亡，而非身体部位：
data.enText: Excruciating can describe feelings, treatments or death but not parts of the body.
an excruciating throat/back/knee
burning
painful and giving a feeling of being very hot

data.chText: 她感到咽喉火辣辣的疼。
data.enText: She felt a burning sensation in her throat.
painful/sore/raw skin
painful/sore eyes
a sore throat
a painful/an excruciating death/procedure
a painful/burning sensation
excruciating/burning pain
really/pretty/quite painful/sore/raw/excruciating
very/extremely/slightly/a bit/a little painful/sore/raw

ex.enText: He has a pain in his stomach.
The pain in her shoulders had come back.

ex.chText: 她无法从失去心爱宠物的痛苦中恢复过来。
ex.enText: She couldn't get over the pain of losing her beloved pet.

synonyms.bx: 指肉体上的疼痛或精神上的痛苦。

ex.chText: 这里有一些建议，告诉你如何在年底的各种庆祝活动中避免胃痛。
ex.enText: Here are some pieces of advice to avoid a stomach ache during the year-end celebrations.

synonyms.bx: 指身体上隐隐的、持续的疼痛，也可喻指心中的痛，常用以构成复合词。

ex.enText: Keep that sore on your hand away from water.

ex.chText: 她帮他在痛处搽了一些碘酒。
ex.enText: She helped him to put some iodine on that sore.

synonyms.bx: 指身体上受到创伤或感染的疼痛部位。

data.enText: a sore point
a subject that makes you feel angry or upset when it is mentioned

data.chText: 孩子们至今未受洗礼，这是休的父母的一件伤心事。
data.enText: It's a sore point with Sue's parents that the children have not been baptized yet.
stand/stick out like a sore thumb
to be very noticeable in an unpleasant way
like a bear with a sore head
bad-tempered or in a bad-tempered way
a sight for sore eyes

data.chText: 喜欢见到的人（或物）；赏心悦目的事物
data.enText: a person or thing that you are pleased to see; something that is very pleasant to look at

example: stayed huffy a good while"- Mark Twai
she gets mad when you wake her up so early
the tender spot on his jaw

tr: causing misery or pain or distress
example: it was a sore trial to him
the painful process of growing up

value.def: If part of your body is sore, it causes you pain and discomfort.

example.ex: It's years since  I've had a sore throat like I did last night...
example.tran: 我的喉咙已经好几年没有像昨晚那样疼了。

example.ex: My chest is still sore from the surgery.
example.tran: 手术过后我的胸口还在作痛。

example.ex: The soreness lasted for about six weeks.
example.tran: 这种疼痛持续了大约 6 周时间。

value.def: If you are sore about something, you are angry and upset about it.

example.ex: The result is that they are now all feeling very sore at you...
example.tran: 结果就是，现在他们都对你感到十分恼火。

example.ex: They are sore about losing to England in the quarter-finals.
example.tran: 他们对在四分之一决赛里输给英格兰队这件事感到非常懊恼。

value.def: A sore is a painful place on the body where the skin is infected.
value.tran: 皮肤发炎疼痛处;疮肿;溃疡

value.def: If something is a sore point with someone, it is likely to make them angry or embarrassed if you try to discuss it.

example.ex: The continuing presence of American troops on Korean soil remains a very sore point with these students.
example.tran: 美国军队继续驻扎在韩国领土上这一事实仍然让这些学生深感气愤。

value.tran: 痛处;惹人生气的话题;令人难堪的话题

xrse.def: to stick out like a sore thumb

trans: 压疮；称压迫疮；褥疮；褥疮性溃疡；压迫性溃疡
眼痛；眼疼；红眼症；眼睛痛
口腔溃疡；溃疡痛；口疮；溃疡；鹅口疮
